item.description:
Short notice, but I just found out that "Monsters from the Id" will be shown tonight, and I am a geeky scifi film and space-race nut.  The film "examines this space-race era phenomenon as the Connecticut Film Festival returns for its monthly screening. The 1950’s was an idealistic time in American history, filled with hope, opportunity, and wonder. New technology promised to save humanity -- and put it in jeopardy. This mood gave birth to one of the most prolific genres in film history: 1950’s Science Fiction Cinema."

$9 adults, $7 for seniors and students

Tickets available at the door or at www.ctfilmfest.com  

52 minutes running time.

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1323940/

 

 

(I know, we have another movie Meetup on Friday night.  PLUS Real Art Ways is having a special talkback after tonight's screening of "El Bulli."  It's just an embarrassment of Indie Movie riches tonight!  Choose your favourite.)
item.how_to_find_us: I'm a short brunette and will be wearing a red sweater and tan jacket.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: CT Film Fest - "Monsters from the Id"
